<p>From one of the projects I've been working on, a jQuery copy-to-clipboard plugin that utilizes the <a href="https://github.com/patricklodder/jquery-zclip" rel="nofollow noreferrer">ZeroClipboard</a> library.</p>
<p>It is easier to use than the native Zero Clipboard plugin if you're a heavy jQuery user.</p>

<p>As of Flash 10, you can only copy to clipboard if the action originates from user interaction with a Flash object. (<a href="http://www.adobe.com/devnet/flashplayer/articles/fplayer10_security_changes_02.html#head31" rel="nofollow noreferrer">Read the related section from Adobe's Flash 10 announcement</a>.)</p>
<p>The solution is to overlay a Flash object above the Copy button, or whatever element initiates the copy. ZeroClipboard is currently the best library with this implementation. Experienced Flash developers may just want to make their own library.</p>
rows.title: How do I copy to the clipboard in JavaScript?
